{"step_by_step_thinking": "Phenytoin is an antiepileptic drug commonly used to treat seizures. It is known to have several side effects. To determine the most common side effect of phenytoin, we need to review the literature and clinical experience. Based on the available information, one of the most common side effects of phenytoin is gingival hyperplasia, which is an overgrowth of the gum tissue. Gingival necrosis, dental stains, and hypertension are not commonly associated with phenytoin use.", "answer_choice": "A"}
